answers.answer: Hi, welcome to the forum, there can be possibility of drug allergy to lexapro but it is not common. Some patients have reported to have itching, rash and development of hives. This can be managed by anti histamines. The later symptoms can be due to delayed reaction and can be managed by corticosteroids and pain killers.Another possibility is it can be due to deficiency of vitamin B12. It is a type of neuropathy. The other possibilities are diabetes, alcoholism, mal absorption syndrome etc. This can be prevented by taking meat liver which is a rich source. Otherwise oral and injectable preparations are available. I suggest you to consult physician for further evaluation and treatment. Take care and regards.
